item.title: Ticket #100 (Support for a "keywords" field) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
I came here through the recent discussion in the wp-hackers mailing list (web output, I am not yet a member). One of the advantages that MT has over WP when it comes to keywords is that it supports them at the XMLRPC level. Do you have any ideas how it would be possible to fix such a thing?

In more details, MT extends the metaWeblog API to support a mt_keywords field when editing and creating posts.

item.title: Ticket #209 (Subject line of sent e-mails is not UTF-8) updated
item.dc:creator: cal
item.description:
the attached patch adds the function mail_encoded() with a similar prototype to mail().

it added the relevant email headers (mime-type, version and optionally from) and escapes the subject using quoted printable.

item.title: Changeset [1579]: Limit number of posts displayed on the edit posts page to 15 unless ...
item.dc:creator: rboren
item.description: Limit number of posts displayed on the edit posts page to 15 unless searching by month. In that case, show all posts for that month. Regression from 1.2. Reported by shelleyp.

item.title: Changeset [1578]: Require upgrade-functions.php so that call to upgrade_all() does not ...

item.description: Require upgrade-functions.php so that call to upgrade_all() does not fail. Reported by shelleyp, fixed by 2fargon.

item.title: Ticket #244 (Delete Confirm doesn't wait) updated
item.dc:creator: matt
item.description: Not a conflict, this is a bug that should be filed with the TBE people. TBE breaks <strong>all</strong> javascript confirmations.

item.title: Ticket #244 (Delete Confirm doesn't wait) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: hmmmm.... so is it a conflict with the tab browser extention? Short of disabling the extention, is there something else I can do? And/Or is there something in the works to "fix" it?

item.title: Ticket #244 (Delete Confirm doesn't wait) updated
item.dc:creator: matt
item.description: This has been reported by people who use the Tab Browser Extensions.

item.title: Ticket #244 (Delete Confirm doesn't wait) created
item.dc:creator: TechGnome
item.description:
When deleting a post, WP doesn't wait for the user to confirm or cancel the delete. It just deletes the post anyways.

Not sure if this was fixed as part of issue 163 or not.

I've had this happen to me on more than one occasion where I deleted the wrong post because it didn't wait for me to click OK or Cancel.

item.title: Ticket #219 (RSS Summary strips links from description.) updated
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
Perhaps this should be changed, as it doesn't seem intuitive?

The behavior I expected was shortening of the description, and any links started within that block, would be closed at their normal space, or at the end, if the link keywords extend beyond the max summary size.

I would be more than willing to whip up a patch for this if you'd like this changed in the core.

Expected behavior of the patch where summary size is limited to 30 chars

Case 1. Links are in body, and don't need to be cut. Link markup isn't treated against character limit for summary. Desc: The lazy [a href="​http://wordpress.org"]brown foxa jumped over the dog. Summary: The lazy [a href="​http://wordpress.org"]brown foxa jumped over...

Case 2. Links are in body, and end link DOES need to be cut. Link markup isn't treated against character limit for summary.

Desc: The really lazy brown fox [a href="​http://brainscat.com"]jumped[/a] over nothing. Summary: The really lazy brown fox [a href="​http://brainscat.com"]jump[/a]...

~Tor (forgot to login) edited: 'cause mosquito doesn't like links

edited on: 08-30-04 15:11

item.title: Ticket #243 (Multiple Time Zones for Multiple Authors) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description: It seems that if there are multiple authors in different parts of the nation (such as USA) or even countries (such as India and USA), Wordpress does not allow you to setup timezones per author. Is it possible? Can it be done?

item.title: Ticket #242 (Geo Url meta header) created
item.dc:creator: 2fargon
item.description:
The geo url related <meta> tag is set in the index.php page even when the "Use Geographic Tracking Features" is not selected by the user. This happens when the "Use default location values if none specified." option is selected, even when the user does not choose to use geographic tracking features.

The attached diff for the wp-includes/functions.php ensures that the geo meta tag is sent/set only when the use_geo_positions option is set.
